    • Method Detail

      • getAdmin

        AdminView getAdmin()
        This function is called in AddDialog and ModifyDialog to access variables within Admin, particularly to see what keywords are already used so that no duplicates are allowed
        Returns:
        Returns the admin object that was given in the main

      • setKeywordChanged

        void setKeywordChanged(boolean change)
        Called in modify Dialog to see if the content was changed. Boolean result is used in modifyData function to see if a query is needed for the change of the keyWord
        Parameters:
        change - True if keyWord was changed, false otherwise

      • setErrorMessageChanged

        void setErrorMessageChanged(boolean change)
        Called in modify Dialog to see if the content was changed. Boolean result is used in modifyData function to see if a query is needed for the change of the error message
        Parameters:
        change - True if error message was changed, false otherwise

      • setSuggestedSolutionChanged

        void setSuggestedSolutionChanged(boolean change)
        Called in modify Dialog to see if the content was changed. Boolean result is used in modifyData function to see if a query is needed for the change of the solution message
        Parameters:
        change - True if solution message was changed, false otherwise

      • setFolderChanged

        void setFolderChanged(boolean change)
        Called in modify Dialog to see if the content was changed. Boolean result is used in modifyData function to see if a query is needed for the change of the folder name
        Parameters:
        change - True if folder name was changed, false otherwise

      • setList

        void setList(java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> list)
        This function is called in AdminView to intialize the contents of the list
        Parameters:
        list - A list of the entries of the table from AdminView

      • setDefaultList

        void setDefaultList(java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> defaultList)
        This function is called in AdminView to intialize the contents of the defaultList
        Parameters:
        defaultList - A list of the entries of the table from AdminView

      • getList

        java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> getList()
        This function is called in AdminView to either retrieve the contents to change the JTable, or to clear the list if the user wants to revert their changes
        Returns:
        Returns the list which reflects the user changes

      • getDefaultList

        java.util.List<java.lang.String[]> getDefaultList()
        This function is called in AdminView to get the old content when the user wants to revert their changes back to the default
        Returns:
        Returns the list which reflects the current contents of the DB

      • modifyData

        protected void modifyData(java.lang.String folder,
                          java.lang.String keyWord,
                          java.lang.String message,
                          java.lang.String solution,
                          java.lang.String choice,
                          int row)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This function modfies the data by depending on the value of "choice". It is called in both ModifyDialog and AddDialog. If the value is "MODIFY" then the function modifies an entry by modifying list, and by adding a query to the queries data structure. If the value is "ADD", then the function adds an entry to list and adds a query that makes an entry reflecting the values given by the user.
        Parameters:
        folder - The folder name given by the user
        keyWord - The keyWord given by the user - cannot be an existing keyword
        message - The error message given by the user
        solution - The solution message given by the user
        choice - Determines whether the user is modifying or adding entries
        row - If the choice is MODIFY, the row index that is being modified
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if connection failed

      • addSingleQuote

        private java.lang.String addSingleQuote(java.lang.String oldWord)
        Adds single quotes to the parameter old word, because SQL syntax uses single quotes to encapsulate; i.e. if we had an error message that said I want to make 'examples' There would be an error with the single quotes. This function adds single quotes to change the message to: I want to make ''examples'' to that this will bypass the error and keep the message intact.
        Parameters:
        oldWord - A string that will be modified
        Returns:
        Returns old word but with additional single quotes if need be

      • deleteData

        protected void deleteData(int row)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        When the user highlights a piece of data and then clicks the delete button, this function will add a query to queries that will delete the row, and also deletes the corresponding row within list.
        Parameters:
        row - - the row in which the data will be deleted
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if connection failed

      • transferData

        protected void transferData(java.lang.String choice)
        Transfers the data within defaultList or list, and creates a new Object[][] for AdminView so that the table in AdminView accurately reflects what the user wants to see. If choice is "DEFAULT" then the contents of list become that of defaultList and the list of queries is cleared. Otherwise, the contents of list are used to create table entries.
        Parameters:
        choice - Either sets contents of defaultList to list or vice versa

      • getData

        protected java.lang.Object[][] getData()
        Called in AdminView after the data has been changed, and the contents of data are used to generate the table entries in AdminView.
        Returns:
        Returns the data object which contains entries reflecting user actions

      • saveDefault

        protected void saveDefault()
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                           java.sql.SQLException
        This function goes through all the strings in queries and sends them to the database to save the changes that the user has made, so that the database now reflects what is seen in the interface table. The contents of defaultList are set to be the same as the contents in list.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if connection failed
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - thrown if classpath is broken
        java.sql.SQLException - thrown if error connecting to database
